One of my favorite games. Great continuation of the original story, with a better narrative than the first. Though i felt that some of the original darkness was lost, i feel that that was a nessesarry evolution.

Portal 2 is indeed a masterpiece. The amount of humour in the game, well designed levels and mechanics, and very entertaining storyline makes this game a must play. Need I say more, just get it, you won't regret.

Amazing. Just Amazing. This game is a HUGE step-up from the last game. It's longer which I love because that's the biggest flaw to me for the last game. It has a lot more achievements so I have a lot more to do in the game if the story isn't enough. And best of all, there is a co-op mode. That is the best part of Portal 2. Being able to play with a friend is awesome because it opens up a lot more possibilities for new tests. And those tests go to the community chamber part of Portal. I love being able to create your own test and sharing them with the world. And the story is much better in this than the origonal Portal. It shows the back story to Aperature Science and seeing your friend betray you and your enemie to help you instead of your 'friend' betraying you. Also the end of the game is really good and personally, they don't need to make a Portal 3. It ends so well that they could stop right here. I spent over 100 hours into this game and it's probably one of my favorite all time games. And, it's only what, $15? $20? I don't know. If you don't have this game, first what are you doing? But if you don't GO BUY IT! It's a huge cake and no, that isn't a lie. :)

There's a reason why this is one of the highest rated games on Steam.

Good visuals, really awesome story, challenging puzzles, and pretty much endless replayability with the option of making your own levels, which I've spent the majority of this game doing. Also, online AND local co-op.

I played this game before I played the original, and I would reccomend grabbing Portal 1 first. It'll make this game better.

while playing i thought this would be something really, really different... like otherworldly.
a "thank GOD" and an american flag later i thought "ok it is not -that- different". dialogs are 50/50.
but this game can be a lot of fun. it has an interesting industrial, mostly self-governed and self-adjusting, huge mysterious underground factory world that i keep constantly marvelling at while playing.
the shapes and physics are admirable. imho it has a deeper and better story than half-life.
this game reminded me of what a good game is.
i also liked the gameplay length of it, because it seems just long enough to get a feeling for the desperation in the testing world.
the atmosphere, game mechanics and progression of the game were excellent.
could have demanded more aim/dexterity related skills.

also play portal 1, preferably first. portal 1 has a little different style of tests.
Nice mazes to go through and talking to robots with an attitude.
